2017 WW38-WW39 NFVi BKC Release Announcement (\r\n BKC #18)

\r\n \r\n \r\n

DEG Platform Integration Team

\r\n \r\n
\r\n

The DEG platform Integration team announces the release of 2017 WW38-WW39 NFVi BKC release package for Intel internal use. The release is based on OS of\r\n \r\n RHEL7.3/\r\n \r\n Ubuntu14.04.5/\r\n \r\n Ubuntu16.04.1\r\n server. The auto-installer packages are available in the Artifactory server (both SH site and OR site). Any questions please contact Ren, Shu.

\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n
Auto InstallerSH Artifactory ServerOR Artifactory Server

*Note: Please select the server which is closer to your region to get the better data accessing/downloading performance

\r\n   Summary \r\n
\r\n
\r\n
\r\n
\r\n
\r\n
\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n
\r\n

Key Update

  • Total test cases: 250; Attempted test cases: 248 (Attempted\r\nrate:99.2%); Passed test cases: 241 and\r\npass rate is 96.40%
  • This cycle of validation focuses on RHEL7.3 and Ubuntu14.04.5, the release packages are built for all 3 different OSes
  • Upgrade NVMe Card to P4500, 2 storage test cases are blocked by 5346491
  • Configuration/validation OS mapping, more details please refer to the HW configuration
    • System A: WFT + Niantic10G + Lewis Hill QAT, validate on Ubuntu16.04.1 and Ubuntu14.04.5
    • System A+: WFT + FVL25G, validate on Ubuntu14.04.5
    • System B: WFQ + FVL25G + NVMe P3600, validate on RHE7.3 or Ubuntu16.04.1, do validation on one every 2 week, then alternate
P&P Update:

o    Sighting : [5346421][NFVi _WFQ][WW34][DPDK][FVL]Performance drop from 10% in DPDK L3FWD test under Ubuntu VM image with Redhat host.

        - DPDK provides the code change for the issue and verified pass.

        - Set sighting to \'Pending\' state and waiting to the DPDK formal release contains this patch.

o    New sighting : [5346485][NFVi _WFT][WW38][NVMe] Intel P4500 SSD can not pass through to Ubuntu VM from Rhel Host.

        - It blocks partial coverage of P&P data that FIO result on Ubuntu VM is not included this week.

        - It fails in kernel version 4.4.0-31 which is from current BKC. After update kernel to 4.4.0-68, it disappears. 

o    From this cycle, NVMe performance validation has the following changes:

        - SSD switches to Intel P4500 from Intel P3600.

        - Platform switches to WFT from WFQ.


Release Note

\xc2\xb7       \r\nUbuntu14.04.5 is releases\r\nwith kernel 3.13.0-100 generic, only contain the SW package, no auto-installer\r\nsupport, semi-auto installation step as below:

\xc2\xa7 \r\nInstall Ubuntu14.04.5 Server

\xc2\xa7 \r\nDownload the SW package and unzip it, Copy the APP folder to\r\n/opt/ of target SUT

\xc2\xa7 \r\nNavigate to /opt/APP/script, run update_kernel.sh to update\r\nkernel to 3.13.0-100, reboot the system 

\xc2\xa7 \r\nNavigate to /opt/APP/script, run setup.sh to install required\r\nlibs and SW dependencies

\xc2\xa7 \r\nNote: All SW\r\ningredients are installed after running /opt/APP/script/setup.sh

\xc2\xb7       \r\nUbuntu16.04.1/RHEL7.3 are released as\r\nauto-installer, refer to Auto-Installation Guide for installation details

\xc2\xb7       \r\nPlease refer to README for the WAR details of following 2 issues:

WAR\r\nfor "watchdog\r\nerror when install Ubuntu OS after flash BMC from 0.71.d8978c76"\r\n has been applied into BKC since BKC #10

\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n

"[5346283]\r\nEthtool in kernel4.4.0 can\xe2\x80\x99t set speed for FVL25G PF" is documented as\r\nknown issue from WW27

Steps for applying the permission

  • Go to AGS website:  https://ags.intel.com/identityiq/dashboard.jsf 
  • Select \xe2\x80\x9cSubmit Requests\xe2\x80\x9d; search \xe2\x80\x9cDevTools - JIRA - DEG_Purley - Project Viewer\xe2\x80\x9d ; apply for the permission
  • Use your windows credentials for authentication
